title: Weird cyclic type error

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-confusing
labels.description: Confusing diagnostic error that should be reworked

body:
Given

```rust
use std::io::{Error, ErrorKind};
fn main() {
    let invalide2 = || Error::new(ErrorKind::InvalidInput, "");
    let invalid2 = || Err(invalide2);
    let capture = vec![None, Some("42".to_string())];
    let v = capture.iter().skip(1)
        .map(|x| match x {
          None => invalid2(),
          Some(x) => x.as_str().parse::<usize>().map(|_|invalid2())
        }).collect::<Result<Vec<usize>, ()>>()
        .unwrap();
}
```

The output is

```
error[E0308]: `match` arms have incompatible types
  --> f54.rs:9:22
   |
7  |           .map(|x| match x {
   |  __________________-
8  | |           None => invalid2(),
   | |                   ---------- this is found to be of type `Result<_, [closure@f54.rs:3:21: 3:23]>`
9  | |           Some(x) => x.as_str().parse::<usize>().map(|_|invalid2())
   | |                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ cyclic type of infinite size
10 | |         }).collect::<Result<Vec<usize>, ()>>()
   | |_________- `match` arms have incompatible types
```

This is confusing and not very actionable. Changing the label to show the tracked type inside of `CyclicTy` we get

```
error[E0308]: `match` arms have incompatible types
  --> f54.rs:9:22
   |
7  |           .map(|x| match x {
   |  __________________-
8  | |           None => invalid2(),
   | |                   ---------- this is found to be of type `Result<_, [closure@f54.rs:3:21: 3:23]>`
9  | |           Some(x) => x.as_str().parse::<usize>().map(|_|invalid2())
   | |                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ cyclic type of infinite size `Result<_, [closure@f54.rs:3:21: 3:23]>`
10 | |         }).collect::<Result<Vec<usize>, ()>>()
   | |_________- `match` arms have incompatible types
```

which still doesn't give enough context and really is more confusing than anything.
_Taken from https://github.com/mcclure/rust-bug/blob/infinite/src/main.rs_
